prompt: Critically discuss classical and operant conditioning, comparing their mechanisms, key experiments, and applications in behavior change (e.g., phobias, habit formation, education).

criteria.name: Theoretical Understanding
criteria.description: Explains classical vs. operant conditioning accurately.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Precisely distinguishes CS/US/UR/CR, reinforcement vs. punishment, schedules, extinction, generalization, and discrimination.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurate explanation with minor omissions (e.g., partial schedules).
performance_descriptors.average: Basic coverage; occasional confusion between concepts.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Discusses Pavlov, Watson and Rayner (Little Albert), Skinner boxes, schedules of reinforcement, and contemporary replications/updates.
performance_descriptors.good: Covers several key studies with acceptable accuracy.

criteria.name: Applications and Ethics
criteria.description: Applies principles to behavior change and considers ethics.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully applies conditioning to exposure therapy, habit formation, classroom management, animal training, and addresses ethical concerns.
performance_descriptors.good: Reasonable applications with limited ethical discussion.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Compares learning processes, response types (reflexive vs. operant), role of reinforcement, and typical use-cases with clarity.

key_points: Define core components of classical and operant conditioning.
Explain reinforcement schedules and their effects on response persistence.
Use historical and modern examples (e.g., exposure therapy, habit loops).
Discuss ethical considerations and humane practice.
Compare strengths/limitations relative to cognitive approaches.
llm_questions: Explain classical conditioning with the CS-US-CR framework and an original example.
Compare positive vs. negative reinforcement with real-life cases.
How do variable ratio schedules influence persistence of behavior?
Outline an exposure therapy plan using conditioning principles.
What ethical issues arise in behavior modification programs?
